info.title: Codecademy e-Commerce REST API
info.description: Defines the backend logic relating to the 'registration', 'customers', 'addresses', 'orders', 'products', 'cart', and 'login' endpoints of an e-commerce REST API. GET operations can be performed directly on the HEROKU database; POST/PUT/DELETE operations can be performed on the SWAGGER HUB virtual mocking server so that the HEROKU database is not compromised.

put.summary: Update the quantity of a particular product in the customer's cart
put.description: Updates the quantity of a particular product in the shopping cart of the customer specified by 'customerId'. As this is only an update operation, if an invalid 'customerId' or 'productId' is passed to this endpoint then the 'update' occurs to a non-existing record and a success response is returned.

200.description: A string confirmation that the quantity of a particular product has been updated

text/html; charset=utf-8.example: Quantity (9) of product with id 3 updated successfully.

delete.summary: Delete a particular product from the specified customer's cart
delete.description: Removes the product specified by 'productId' from the shopping cart of the customer specified by 'customerId'. As this is only a delete operation, if an incorrect 'customerId' or 'productId' is present then the 'delete' occurs on an empty field and a success response is returned.

200.description: String confirmation that the product specified by 'productId' has been removed from the shopping cart of the customer specified by 'customerId'

text/html; charset=utf-8.example: Product with id {productId} removed from your cart.

500.description: Returns a description of the error {err} that was unexpectedly encountered

post.summary: Save the specified customer's order to the database and clears the customer's shopping cart
post.description: This endpoint is used once the customer specified by 'customerId' has successfully paid for their items. It saves the customer's order to the 'orders' table, clears the shopping cart associated with the customer in the 'cart' table, and returns a string confirmation of this process.

200.description: String confirmation that the customer's order has been saved and their cart has been cleared.

text/html; charset=utf-8.example: Your transaction has been added to your order history and your cart has been cleared. We hope you enjoy your purchase!

404.description: No cart is associated with the specified customer.

schema.example: Your cart is empty so there is nothing to process!

500.description: Returns a description of the error {err} that was unexpectedly encountered

get.summary: Render a form that allows the customer to log in

200.description: Successful render of the login page

post.summary: Process the customer's submitted username and password
post.description: This endpoint receives a 'username' and 'password' and either renders the 'Logged In View' or redirects to the 'Login Failure View', depending on whether the supplied fields authenticate successfully.

200.description: Used to describe 2 possible outcomes - 1. Successful authentication of the user-supplied username and password, and the subsequent rendering of the 'Logged In View'; and 2. The '302' redirection and subsequent '200' rendering of the 'Login Failure View' in response to unsuccessful authentication of the user-supplied username and password.

0.value: Logged In View/Login Failure View (depending on authentication status)

post.description: Allows the user to log out, redirecting them to the 'Login View'.

200.description: Denotes the user's logout success.
